In the wake of increased media coverage of people going missing, South Africa’s newly appointed police minister, took to social media to offer advice.“Assist us in finding you if the worst happens,” Minister Fikile Mbalula tweeted. “Your IMEI number can be of great use”.The minister had attached an image which encouraged the public to find out what their IMEI numbers are, as these could help trace the last or current location of the phone user “even if the sim card had been removed from ur phone [sic]” the image’s text read.“Give ur IMEI NUMBER to family and friends so that when u disappear without an explanation and ur phone is off or rings unanswered, they can make the case easy for the police by providing them with this number which can then be used to track ur movements,” it further said.Two readers asked us to check if this really works.
